CatDescriptText: Archie Johnson, messenger, 8373 Vidette Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 7, 1959, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think that the Wacs and others women's units, with the exception of nurses, should be abolished in armed services during peacetime? Why?" answer reads: "From the way I look at it, the kids are the rulers of the homes.  I guess it is because the parents do not give the children enough attention, probably because of such things like television, cooking, or talking on the telephone."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Archie Johnson wearing coat with toggles and knitted collar, and dark hat with band, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Bud Saunder's Flowers store window, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
